intro: Eryngium altamiranoi, commonly known as the Altamirano thistle, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its unique morphology, including its tall, spiky appearance, makes it stand out in its native environment. Eryngium altamiranoi is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance.
